info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 04 at 5:25PM EDT until May 04 at 6:15PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southwestern Mecklenburg County in the Piedmont of North Carolina... Southeastern Cleveland County in the Piedmont of North Carolina... South central Gaston County in the Piedmont of North Carolina... York County in Upstate South Carolina... Eastern Cherokee County in Upstate South Carolina... * Until 615 PM EDT. * At 524 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 9 miles southwest of Gastonia to 11 miles southeast of Gaffney, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to trees and power lines. * Locations impacted include... York, Tega Cay, Clover, Newport, Blacksburg, Grover, Sharon, Hickory Grove, Mcconnells and Smyrna. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to minor flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Please report damaging winds, hail, or flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, or by posting on our Facebook page, or Tweet it using hashtag nwsgsp. Your message should describe the event and the specific location where it occurred.
